command: [Net.ServicePointManager]::SecurityProtocol=[Net.SecurityProtocolType]::Tls12; $ts=Get-Date -Format o; try { $headers=@{ 'x-apikey'=$env:VT_API_KEY; 'Accept'='application/json' }; $r=Invoke-WebRequest -Uri 'https://www.virustotal.com/api/v3/domains/contoso.com' -Headers $headers -Method Get -ErrorAction Stop; ($r.Content | ConvertFrom-Json | Select-Object -ExpandProperty data | Select-Object id,@{n='reputation';e={$_.attributes.reputation}},@{n='last_analysis_stats';e={$_.attributes.last_analysis_stats}} | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 6) | Out-File -FilePath "$env:TEMP\virustotal_domain_contoso.json" -Encoding utf8; Add-Content -Path "$env:TEMP\recon.log" -Value "$ts VirusTotal success contoso.com" } catch { Add-Content -Path "$env:TEMP\recon.log" -Value "$ts VirusTotal error: $($_.Exception.Message)" }
explanation: Uses VirusTotal v3 (API key required) to gather reputation and analysis statistics on the target domain, returning a structured subset and logging the operation.
rationale_steps: Access a gated threat intelligence provider via API key.
Request domain reputation and analysis metadata.
Serialize only key attributes to JSON to reduce noise.
Record operational status to a local log.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell command is perfectly well-formed with proper syntax, balanced quotes/braces/parentheses, correct use of semicolons as command separators, valid parameter names, and proper error handling with try/catch.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly aligns with T1597 (Search Closed Sources) by using a paid/private API (VirusTotal) with an API key to gather intelligence on a target domain, storing the results locally for analysis, and logging the operation.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed, with balanced syntax, proper command separators, and correct PowerShell cmdlet usage and object manipulation.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly achieves its claimed intent of using VirusTotal via an API key to gather domain intelligence, which aligns with acquiring information from 'closed sources' (paid feeds/APIs) as described by T1597 for targeting purposes.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: PowerShell is well-formed with correct try/catch, balanced quotes/parentheses, valid headers, pipelines, and parameters.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It queries VirusTotal’s v3 API with an API key to obtain domain reputation and analysis stats, saving and logging results, aligning with T1597 use of closed/paid sources.
